properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A small area of thunderstorms containing heavy downpours is rumbling east across the region this evening. Local rainfall amounts near 30 mm in an hour or less are likely in the heaviest thunderstorms. Wind gusts near 60 km/h are also possible. Motorists should be prepared for sudden very low visibility in heavy downpours. Poorly drained sections of highways may be subject to sudden ponding of water. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-06T05:59:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-06T00:21:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3723881500.2020
Area: Maxville - Alexandria, Cornwall - Lancaster, Winchester - Newington, Morrisburg - Long Sault, Prescott and Russell
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Escaped Prisoner From Northeast Nova Scotia Correctional Facility
properties.Summary:
Description: An inmate has escaped from the Northeast Correctional Facility in Pictou County, Nova Scotia at approximately 8:30 pm tonight. Kevin Edward Clarke-McNeil is incarcerated on serious criminal charges including Attempted Murder. Do not contact or approach Clarke-McNeil, call 911 or local police. Clarke-McNeil may attempt to return to the Halifax area. Described as a 5-foot-8 white male, 200 pounds, long brown curly hair and a large beard, last seen wearing no shirt and grey jogging pants.
Expires: 2020-06-06T23:45:00-03:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Nova Scotia Emergency Management Office, 2020-06-05T23:57:32-03:00, DBDEE383-33D7-8427-69D8-C62BD39C25A2
Area: Antigonish County, Colchester County, Cumberland County, Halifax Regional Municipality, Hants County and Pictou County.
properties.Author: Nova Scotia Emergency Management Office

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Thunderstorms may affect western Lake Ontario this evening. Squalls to 40 knots are possible. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-06-06T04:10:44-00:00

Area: Western Lake Ontario
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A nearly stationary east to west line of showers and thunderstorms is affecting areas north of Timmins and Kapuskasing. Local rainfall amounts of up to 75 mm will be possible by later this evening. Locations impacted include: Fraserdale, Little Abitibi Provincial Park, Relay, Abitibi Canyon, Brownrigg and Island Falls. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-06T06:39:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-05T21:44:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1053968964.2020
Area: Fraserdale - Pledger Lake, Little Abitibi - Kesagami Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing heavy rain. Thunderstorms will form this evening and could last until Saturday morning. Boaters may be surprised by strong wind gusts over bodies of water. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-06T11:50:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-05T19:51:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4116918774.2020

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times. An area of strong thunderstorms continues to move eastward over parts of western and northern Gulf-Magdalen. These storms may give local gusts to 35 knots. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-06-06T04:52:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-06T00:54:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4037634102.2020
Area: Gulf - Magdalen
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant Rainfall for Northeastern BC This Weekend. A series of disturbances will move through northern BC bringing periods of moderate to heavy rainfall tonight through Monday. Potential impacts for this event include rising rivers and destabilizing slopes. An already moist air mass will be enhanced by upslope flow, particularly on the east slopes of the Northern Rockies. The communities of Liard River, Muncho Lake, Toad River, Nelson Forks, Sikanni Chief and their surrounding higher terrain may see up to 50 to 80 mm of total rainfall. These areas have experienced moderate rainfall events over the past few weeks thus the ground is quite saturated in some places. Stay tuned to your local weather forecast and alerts: www.weather.gc.ca Flood Warnings and Advisories can be viewed at: http://bcrfc.env.gov.bc.ca/warnings/index.htm Road Conditions: https://drivebc.ca/ ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-06T17:18:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-06T01:19:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0874320657.2020
Area: B.C. South Peace River, B.C. North Peace River, Fort Nelson
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms will move into the area this evening. The risk of strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain will persist until early Saturday morning. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-06T17:59:25-00:00
